  • Element
com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect

Annotation Type TEffect


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=ANNOTATION_TYPE)
public @interface TEffect
     The annotation version for the abstract base class for all effect implementations. 
 An effect is a graphical algorithm that produces an image, typically as a modification 
 of a source image. An effect can be associated with a scene graph Node by setting the 
 Node.effect attribute. 
 
 Some effects change the color properties of the source pixels (such as ColorAdjust), others 
 combine multiple images together (such as Blend), while still others warp or move the pixels 
 of the source image around (such as DisplacementMap or PerspectiveTransform). All effects 
 have at least one input defined and the input can be set to another effect to chain the effects 
 together and combine their results, or it can be left unspecified in which case the effect will 
 operate on a graphical rendering of the node it is attached to.
 
 
    Atention, just one effect can be set.

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      boolean parse
      Force the parser execution

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      TBloom bloom
      A high-level effect that makes brighter portions of the input image appear to glow, based on a configurable threshold.
      TBoxBlur boxBlur
      A blur effect using a simple box filter kernel, with separately configurable sizes in both dimensions, and an iteration parameter that controls the quality of the resulting blur.
      TColorAdjust colorAdjust
      An effect that allows for per-pixel adjustments of hue, saturation, brightness, and contrast.
      TColorInput colorInput
      An effect that renders a rectangular region that is filled ("flooded") with the given Paint.
      TDisplacementMap displacementMap
      An effect that shifts each pixel by a distance specified by the first two bands of the specified FloatMap.
      TDropShadow dropShadow
      A high-level effect that renders a shadow of the given content behind the content with the specified color, radius, and offset.
      TGaussianBlur gaussianBlur
      A blur effect using a Gaussian convolution kernel, with a configurable radius.
      TGlow glow
      A high-level effect that makes the input image appear to glow, based on a configurable threshold.
      TInnerShadow innerShadow
      A high-level effect that renders a shadow inside the edges of the given content with the specified color, radius, and offset.
      TLighting lighting
      An effect that simulates a light source shining on the given content, which can be used to give flat objects a more realistic, three-dimensional appearance.
      TMotionBlur motionBlur
      A motion blur effect using a Gaussian convolution kernel, with a configurable radius and angle.
      java.lang.Class<? extends ITEffectParse> parser
      The parser class for this annotation.
      TPerspectiveTransform perspectiveTransform
      An effect that provides non-affine transformation of the input content.
      TReflection reflection
      An effect that renders a reflected version of the input below the actual input content.
      TSepiaTone sepiaTone
      A filter that produces a sepia tone effect, similar to antique photographs.
      TShadow shadow
      An effect which creates a monochrome duplicate of an input with blurry edges.

        public abstract boolean parse
         Force the parser execution

         The parser class for this annotation.

        Default:
        com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.parser.TEffectParser.class

 image appear to glow, based on a configurable threshold.
        See Also:
        TBloom
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TBloom(input=com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TEffect.NullEffectBuilder.class)

      • boxBlur

        public abstract TBoxBlur boxBlur

 configurable sizes in both dimensions, and an iteration parameter
 that controls the quality of the resulting blur.
        See Also:
        TBoxBlur
        Default:

      • colorAdjust

         An effect that allows for per-pixel adjustments of hue, 
 saturation, brightness, and contrast.
        See Also:
        TColorAdjust
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TColorAdjust(input=com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TEffect.NullEffectBuilder.class)

      • colorInput

        public abstract TColorInput colorInput
         An effect that renders a rectangular region that is filled 
 ("flooded") with the given Paint. This is equivalent to rendering 
 a filled rectangle into an image and using an ImageInput effect, 
 except that it is more convenient and potentially much more efficient.
        See Also:
        TColorInput
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TColorInput(input=com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TEffect.NullEffectBuilder.class)

      • displacementMap

        public abstract TDisplacementMap displacementMap
         An effect that shifts each pixel by a distance specified by the first two bands of
 the specified FloatMap. For each pixel in the output, the corresponding data from the
 mapData is retrieved, scaled and offset by the scale and offset attributes, scaled again
 by the size of the source input image and used as an offset from the destination pixel
 to retrieve the pixel data from the source input.
 
 dst[x,y] = src[(x,y) + (offset+scale*map[x,y])*(srcw,srch)]
 
 A value of (0.0, 0.0) would specify no offset for the pixel data whereas a value
 of (0.5, 0.5) would specify an offset of half of the source image size.
        See Also:
        TDisplacementMap
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TDisplacementMap(input=com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TEffect.NullEffectBuilder.class)

      • dropShadow

        public abstract TDropShadow dropShadow
         A high-level effect that renders a shadow of the given content 
 behind the content with the specified color, radius, and offset.
        See Also:
        TDropShadow
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TDropShadow(input=com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TEffect.NullEffectBuilder.class)

      • gaussianBlur

        public abstract TGaussianBlur gaussianBlur
         A blur effect using a Gaussian convolution kernel, 
 with a configurable radius.
        See Also:
        TGaussianBlur
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TGaussianBlur(input=com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TEffect.NullEffectBuilder.class)

      • glow

        public abstract TGlow glow
         A high-level effect that makes the input image appear to glow, 
 based on a configurable threshold.
        See Also:

        Default:

 of the given content with the specified color, radius, and offset.
        See Also:
        TInnerShadow
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TInnerShadow(input=com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TEffect.NullEffectBuilder.class)

      • lighting

        public abstract TLighting lighting
         An effect that simulates a light source shining on
 the given content, which can be used to give flat
 objects a more realistic, three-dimensional appearance.
        See Also:
        TLighting
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TLighting(bumpInput=com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TEffect.NullEffectBuilder.class)

      • motionBlur

        public abstract TMotionBlur motionBlur
         A motion blur effect using a Gaussian convolution kernel, 
 with a configurable radius and angle.
        See Also:
        TMotionBlur
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TMotionBlur(input=com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TEffect.NullEffectBuilder.class)

      • perspectiveTransform

        public abstract TPerspectiveTransform perspectiveTransform
         An effect that provides non-affine transformation of the input content. 
 Most typically PerspectiveTransform is used to provide a "faux" three-dimensional 
 effect for otherwise two-dimensional content.
        See Also:
        TPerspectiveTransform
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TPerspectiveTransform(input=com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TEffect.NullEffectBuilder.class)

      • reflection

        public abstract TReflection reflection
         An effect that renders a reflected version of the input below the actual input content.
 Note that the reflection of a Node with a Reflection effect installed will not respond 
 to mouse events or the containment methods on the Node.
        See Also:
        TReflection
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TReflection(input=com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TEffect.NullEffectBuilder.class)

      • sepiaTone

        public abstract TSepiaTone sepiaTone
         A filter that produces a sepia tone effect, similar to antique photographs.
        See Also:
        TSepiaTone
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TSepiaTone(input=com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TEffect.NullEffectBuilder.class)

      • shadow

        public abstract TShadow shadow
         An effect which creates a monochrome duplicate of an 
 input with blurry edges. This effect is primarily used 
 along with its default black color for purposes of 
 combining it with the original to create a shadow. 
 It can also be used with a light color and combined 
 with an original to create a glow effect.
        See Also:
        TShadow
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TShadow(input=com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.effect.TEffect.NullEffectBuilder.class)
